CatDescriptText: Mr. John Wade, 18 Ledue Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" answer reads: "I think they should if they want to keep their neighborhoods clean."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Wade, wearing striped angled cap, plaid shirt, and belt with light colored stitching, holding folded newspaper with headline "Tap on Cop's Door Led to Solution" under arm, standing in front of brick wall
